Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.client

Interface PushPromise

public interface PushPromise
Represents an HTTP/2 server push promise (PUSH_PROMISE frame).

When an HTTP/2 server pushes a resource, the client receives a push promise containing the headers that would have been sent in a request for that resource. The client can choose to accept or reject the push.

This interface is delivered to the HTTPResponseHandler.pushPromise(PushPromise) callback. The handler must either call accept(HTTPResponseHandler) to receive the pushed response, or reject() to cancel it.

Example: 

 public void pushPromise(PushPromise promise) {
     if (promise.getPath().endsWith(".css")) {
         // Accept CSS pushes
         promise.accept(new CSSResponseHandler());
     } else {
         // Reject other pushes
         promise.reject();
     }
 }
Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • HTTPResponseHandler.pushPromise(PushPromise)

  • Method Details

    • getMethod

      String getMethod()
      Returns the HTTP method for the promised request.

      Server push is typically only used for GET requests, but the protocol allows other safe methods.

      Returns:
      the HTTP method (usually "GET")

    • getPath

      String getPath()
      Returns the path (including query string) for the promised request.
      Returns:
      the request path

    • getAuthority

      String getAuthority()
      Returns the authority (host and port) for the promised request.
      Returns:
      the authority (e.g., "example.com:443")

    • getScheme

      String getScheme()
      Returns the scheme for the promised request.
      Returns:
      the scheme (typically "https" for HTTP/2)

    • getHeaders

      Headers getHeaders()
      Returns all headers for the promised request.

      This includes the pseudo-headers (:method, :path, :authority, :scheme) as well as any regular headers.

      Returns:
      the headers (never null)

    • accept

      void accept(HTTPResponseHandler handler)
      Accepts the push promise and provides a handler for the pushed response.

      The provided handler will receive the same callbacks as a normal response: HTTPResponseHandler.ok(HTTPResponse), HTTPResponseHandler.header(String, String), body content callbacks, and HTTPResponseHandler.close().

      This method must be called at most once. After calling this method, reject() must not be called.

      Parameters:
      handler - the handler to receive the pushed response

    • reject

      void reject()
      Rejects the push promise.

      This sends an RST_STREAM frame to cancel the promised stream. No further callbacks will be received for this push.

      This method must be called at most once. After calling this method, accept(HTTPResponseHandler) must not be called.
